intro: Cyphostemma chevalieri, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange to red berries. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or scrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in warm climates.
